text.__SUMMARY__: Pultenaea villosa, the hairy bush-pea, is a  shrub which is endemic to south eastern Australia. It is a member of the family Fabaceae and of the genus Pultenaea. A small prostrate or erect shrub. Stems have spreading to curly hairs. The specific epithet villosa is derived from Latin, describing the long loose hairs. This plant first appeared in scientific literature in 1799, in the fourth edition of the Species Plantarum published by the German botanist Carl Ludwig Willdenow.
